message: There you go!!! It's been approved and given the go ahead because that's what 17 million people voted for. You bremoaners can stop throwing your dummies out your prams now just because you lost the referendum and your not getting your own way. Stop hindering the process and deal with it, brexit is happening wether you like it or not.
What on earth is wrong with people like you?  So many of you are unnecessarily rude and aggressive.  Chill.
Far more moaning from the leave camp than from the so-called 'remoaners'!

What is wrong with people trying to block brexit?? The British people were all given the opportunity to vote and alot didn't. Brexit won 52% of the votes as opposed to remain with 48%. Maybe it would of been a different outcome if more people voted but had remain won we would not of been allowed to block the outcome or call for second referendums etc, we would of had to deal with it wether we liked it or not. No need to prolong the inevitable anymore, Theresa May and the majority of MPs are backing the vote. The sooner the better too.
This is just the law of the land.. it was always known than they would need parliamentary approval, that's not blocking it, that's just British law!
Don't people have a right to worry about future ahead of us all. Its uncertain times and if all goes wrong many leave will be moaning about jobs money etc
Brexit was won off the £350m lie told by the leave campaign.
And it's been backed by the parliament. We would of had alot tougher times if we stayed in the EU. I knew what I was voting for when I voted leave. I stand by my vote and I don't regret it.

You wouldn't have been allowed to call for a second referendum? 
How would you have been stopped? Anyone can call for anything.  Protest anything and petition.  
Brexit wasn't blocked. It went through the legal and democratic process.  The very reason so many of the leave voters gave for voting leave was so we could go through them very processes. So much drama over a normal process.  
And of course people are going to fight to protect their interests and livelihoods.  So would you.

Matty Appleton That money is still being payed to the EU, because we haven't left yet!
FYI. That is not why I voted leave. I voted leave because I recent living under a Dictatorship, AKA, Merkel!

Matty Appleton, the leave campaign had no authority to promise anything.  
The was no promise of money anyway.  The bus said 'Let's' in regards to the money which is a request not a promise. 
Anyone who voted for leave on the basis the leave campaigned anything was foolish for those reasons.
Rachael, I don't know how you could have known what you were voting for when they're still clarifying what Brexit actually means now!
How do you know it be worse in the eu. Nobody knows future ahead of us. Year after we leave then tell us if you regret your vote or not. Currently nothing has changed as we still in the eu

No we wouldn't of been given the chance for a second referendum. So much money was spent on the first one, do you really think parliament would of given us a second one to try and make it any different? Yes we could of protested and started up petitions but that wouldn't of made any difference. The outcome is what it is, wether it had been remain or leave. People are too afraid of change and leaving the EU for their own reasons and yes there will be some uncertainty but I've not heard of any so far. The EU isn't all its cracked up to be. And it seems more people want to leave than stay now we've had the guts to get out.
Thank you for voting to destroy my children's future
We are still in eu that's why there has been no uncertainty. Only when we leave will truth be revealed.

And I voted leave because I wanted my daughter to have a better future out of the EU. I wanted to see our country great again. Right now it's not, not while we have Brussels dictating things to us. We waste billions of taxpayers money on it and we don't get anything for it apart from flocks of illegal immigrants trying to get into the country. We have no control of our borders, the nhs, social housing and our education systems are struggling. That money we put to the EU could go to all these things.

Rachel you're making very little sense.  
You're making out like 'renoaners' got a second referendum. They didn't.  So why say you wouldn't have been allowed? People will protest whichever way it goes. To criticise people for exercising their right to protest is not really a good look. It's just a way for you to criticise people who had a different opinion to you.
I am so disturbed by the vitriol hurled at remain voters every step of the way through this whole debacle.   
You get positive news that you want to hear and your response is to attack people who voted the other way to you. What's the point of that?  I just don't get it.
Mark Mckenna get over yourself!! I voted leave for my own personal reasons. That's just the response I'd expect from a typical bremoaner. Everything's all brexit fault.

And there we have it...
Immigrants. 
Oh and we did get funding.  
I'm in the north east and we got money back in funding.  
Without the EU we're screwed up here. The tories won't invest in us.

We won't see any of that money. Eu isn't the problem. Problem is government sending money to countries who don't need it. Big portion of money sent to eu would be sent back. Things aren't going to get better.

Peta Evans we were all entitled to our vote. Fact is alot of people didn't. I was fed up of bieng part of something that wasn't beneficial to us so I voted leave. The only people who really benefited from it were the wealthy. Yes we face some uncertainty but do I regret my vote? No. Would I vote different if I had another chance? No. Do I think the UK is better off out of the EU? Definitely.

Rachael Andrea Sault, you provoked that response really by attacking 'bremoaners'. 
I'd say your post was typical or a 'brexshiter'.
No?
So will you regret your vote if you lose your job and home if economy collapsed due to leaving and no infrastructure to support UK is in place.
Mark Mckenna why did somesome destroy your kids?????
No, I said what I think. You can like it or not but it's water off a ducks back to me.
Rightards getting their way with brexshit

Mark Mckenna  your children wudnt have a future if the young generations of 1914 and world war two didnt give their lives for freedom and then to see this country become what it has ... ghettos .. recessions ...it was the worst thing we ever done was to join the corrupt EU ...look what it has done to greece since taking the eu money theyve destroyed it !! and who is going to bail them out our money again ... we have paid out hand and fist to the infrastruture of poorer countries whilst our country is becomming a shitole ... go brexit love you !!!
So when your struggling to survive because country has gone in to even worse recession. No money to help people no food banks because everyone struggling. Will you still be happy

Sandra Walker the Greeks have said the worse thing they did was take on the euro. Things were better for them when it was the drachma. I lived there for a year back in 2005 and that was what  a Greek person had said.
Kay Bull I stand by my vote. Who's to say that will happen? It's just propoganda and doom and gloom fed to us by the remain campaign.
We're not Greece.
No we are not Greece but we've seen what joining the EU has done to Greece. It's not exactly good is it? Says alot about the EU.

How certain are you it won't happen. I never believe either campaign. I thought on my own accord. What infrastructure do we have what do we have to trade. Its wrong time to leave. We should of invested in to factories etc so we have items to trade. Instead we have very little

That's okay. Mrs May is doing some negotiating with our NHS.
Don't worry. It's not something we need. 
Private health care is the best direction to go

We can make new trade deals with other countries like Australia, the US etc. This opens up new opportunities for us. We are still part of Europe of course and we can still trade with them. We just won't be part of the EU.
Trade deals with what?
Fact is they need us right now more than we need them. What would they do without the millions of pounds they get off us?

They don't need us. Plus Falklands war was due to tory government why would eu help us. Recession was world wide every country was suffering. We have very little to trade. Please tell me what industry do we have in UK that we can sell. Government has closed many factories. Etc.
Yes they do though.  Without out our millions what would they do? They are screwed without the UK.
That's rubbish UK and leave campaign has made people believe. Lot of money we gave would come back to support areas. Areas that now won't have that. What do we manufacturer
I wonder what will happen to the EU once we finally leave? It will be interesting to see.
Not much will happen to eu. Should be more worried about what happen to UK
I'm not worried tbh. I do think the EU is a sinking ship though, I really do. I might be wrong but I think brexit will be a big blow to them.
Eu didn't have much control over UK. They be fine. Its UK that everyone should be concerned about. What do we have to trade. What manufacturing do we have.
Matty Appleton it wasn't!
Mark Mckenna you don't know that!
Kay Bull we buy a lot of goods... why wouldn't nations want to trade with us.  It's business.
Rachael Andrea Sault they will make a go of it I'm sure but it's a failing model.  Germany is the biggest beneficiary!  Finding it hard to prop up other nations though!!
What money will we use to buy. You are aware trade isn't about buying its about what we have to sell to put money in to the economy. If we only buying we be bankrupt in a year.

Britain clearly managed before the EU, and we will again. Some people will know what the country was like before we joined and I bet they can tell a big difference in the state of the country now as opposed to back then. You've just got to stop been so negative about it. It's not all doom and gloom.

I voted out & i have no regrets at all. Even if we do have to live through a few years of tough times I know we'll be better off in the long run, I know I've done the right thing for the future generations of this country. 
Britain isn't great anymore thanks to the Eu leeches but i strongly believe we can be Great again.
We need this revolution !!
Please do some research. Before eu we had manufacturing which many times I have asked what do we manufacturer now and your unable to answer.
Kay Bull that's the whole point though we will HAVE TO start manufacturing again, which will create jobs for the masses of unskilled people.

Kay Bull only recently a car company (think it was Land Rover?) were on the news saying that for them to be able to continue manufacturing in this country they would need to be able to buy parts from this country , so there you have it already, a gap in the market for potential manufacturing business

Yes we will but its wrong time do that now. Should be done in advance to build foundations for leave. We have nothing concrete to support UK we need to invest money that we don't have. Please nobody say about money give to eu nobody will be seeing that but tories. This has been planned badly and we will all suffer.

Kay Bull it's a risk worth taking. We can't be no worse off than we are already. Like Kelly Bridgwater has said I too will gladly take a few tough years to get this country great again. We've got through two world wars, recessions etc, we will get through this.
hahaha messing up my kids future????...the stuff you read on this tinternet is hilarious!

Few tough years without ability feed family etc. Without being able afford roof over your head I don't think so. We should of invested in manufacturing and created industry that will help put money in to economy but we haven't and its far to late now. We can't go to countries to set up trade deals with empty plate and say oh give us few years and we have something to sell. If you went to bank for loan for business but had no plans or foundations in place they would laugh. We are playing with peoples lives. Schools NHS etc suffer even more when we leave during difficult period. That isn't risk we should of been taking. Rich be ok its poor who suffer.
My husband works in one of Europe's biggest vinegar production factories. No doubt the EU are going to want to continue doing trade with them if there aren't many of them.

My roof over my head is secure and fine, we can afford our rent and pay it on time, I always go to a budget on my weekly food shop anyway, I always have done so it's nothing new for me. We will be fine. It's all about positive thinking.
Wow so we all have one business that keep economy going not.

Have you not seen the news? Theresa May has already been setting down foundations to do trade deals with non Eu countries. 
Your going on as if this country has nothing to offer when it does. I work in a large British carpet manufacturing company, a company that has been going for over a hundred years! They were fine before the Eu & they'll be fine out of the Eu.
There will be more than one business. I was just using my husbands workplace as an example. Your only seeing the negative.
Seriously Kay Bull you need to lighten up. Your talking like it's over for our country. That attitude won't help move things along.

They are small industry. When think of UK you don't think vinegar and carpets as main trade. We don't have big trade other then finance and air parts. We used to have steel coal cars etc. When think   france think of champagne Germany BMW. This sort things that we should already of had. Only recently steel factories closed. You have look at bigger picture. I'm not saying not to leave just that should only happen 5-10 years from now when we have industry in place and we making a success of economy.

Yes they are small industries but it's still something our country has to offer. Food production is a big industry and it's in high demand, even if it is just vinegar. Again you only see the negative. This is like banging your head off a brick wall explaining things.

Lighten up when I can only see trouble a head. Remind me tell you lighten up if you lose your home etc 
Will you be happy pay my rent and others who be effected due to leave campaign.
I won't lose my home like I said, we can afford our rent and always pay it on time.

There will never be room for industry while we are still attached to the Eu, it just won't happen, nobody will start businesses here when they can get it cheaper from the Eu, they'll only invest when they know for certain they'll get a good return. 
There's no money for rainy days in the future.
Your not seeing bigger picture small industry won't support economy.

Currently you can afford rent but after Brexit will it be the same. We also can afford ours and both have good jobs but both sensible to know turbulent times ahead and we could lose our jobs like many others. That's the difference we wasn't prepared vote leave and watch people lose homes jobs etc

I am seeing the bigger picture that's why I voted out. The larger industry's will grow as soon as there's a gap in the market for them to do so. 
A local steel foundry where I live makes some of the car parts for ford, Land Rover etc, when those companies cannot get the other parts from the Eu for cheap they will have to get them from here which will prompt investors to expand the business, thus making that industry bigger, production goes up, prices come down. Bigger industries more jobs better economy, that's how it works.

Either way we will get by, why? Because that's what people do and we won't lose our home. It might be a struggle at times but I don't regret my vote. When I voted leave I knew it wouldn't all be a bed of roses, but at the same time I didn't want to be part of this corrupt system anymore.
Rent will reduce do to demand for housing.

John Cheviot Yeti Ingledew  if there is a demand for housing, rents will go up. We'll just have to see how many Eu immigrants/migrants whatever you want to call them will want to or even be able to stay here after we leave.

See always boils down to migrants for people. I know many hard working people from eastern Europe who pay taxes etc. Many come here do jobs that Brits don't want to do. That's problem with UK not the migrants but laziness of many who think manual work is below them.
Kay Bull  no ones job is ever safe, not ever. But I have always looked at life like this, if we ain't dying & we're not going to jail, we'll stick together & we'll be ok.
Kay Bull I never said migrants wasn't hard working. I was replying to John cheviot yeti ingledew's comment about the demand for housing. FYI my father in law was from Austria.
Then your lucky. While I have seen hell of struggling with very little money not knowing when next meal will be. Etc and never would I wish that for anyone.

The scroungers of this country is a whole other topic, but simply the government should make them work for their benefits if they able to do so but choose not to, stick them on a bus & take them to the farms to do the hard graft, maybe then they'll try & get themselves a better job

Kay Bull My family is on living wage and it's hard at times yes but as long as we pay the bills that keep the roof over our heads and we have food in the cupboards we are fine. And that's what we will continue doing. It's about positive thinking. Not all British people think manual work is beneath them. I've just started a part time cleaning job for an agency and have an interview for a second permanent cleaning position next week. I'm prepared to do 2 part time cleaning jobs while my husband works one full time job. If it gets me out the house and earning a little money I won't complain.

Kay Bull we have struggled, since I took out my mortgage 12 years ago both me & my other half have been made redundant over 3 times each, we got by because we had no choice to. I grew up in a council house having bailiffs knock the door & not even 50p for the electric meter sometimes but guess what we survived, it was harsh in the 80s but I'm even grateful for it as it has made me un-materialistic.
& you voted stay kay...after reading your comments I find that flabbergasting
Yes Kelly Bridgwater and then the lack of cheap parts will increase the cost of the car.
Can't stop laughing at all these sad Remoaners.
John Mackie I know. It's the end for the UK. Everything's all brexits fault and those of us who voted out are to blame because we didn't know what we were voting for blah blah etc.

To willingly vote knowing it will cause job loses etc. Prices will increase people will struggle more then ever before. It wasn't the right time to leave. I'm not materialistic I just don't want see people suffer 
The north already has it hard with very little jobs available. Leave will make divide between rich and poor even worse. The government often blame things on eu but nobody be seeing money that we send.

And things will get better after. People had as much right to vote leave as they did remain. There's no use crying about it so to speak. I don't believe the propoganda that is bieng spouted about brexit. In the long term we will make our country better for it and we will be fine.
In fact the leavers had a minimal majority. It was almost level, meaning that the referendum was virtually a tie.
Yes, virtually a tie. But leave still won with 4% more votes.

After people die due to lack of money for NHS after kids don't have decent schooling as no money for books. After people starve etc. 
Its not about propaganda its about knowing these can and possibly will happen. Where will funding come from for NHS etc when we have no viable industry when we have to pay more for simple items.
I think law should be passed that those voted leave should pay more tax so that country can get back on its feet. I'm sure leave voters won't mind
Well with that attitude Kay Bull you remainers won't mind paying the portion of the EU bills us leave voters have been reluctantly paying for years eh! I'd like my money back thanks.

We remainers have also been paying to eu. We aren't ones to vote for country go in to recession again. Seriously you guys won't mind giving up more money in taxes to support country through difficult times ahead. You want leave then you should pay not those who rather remain until country in place where we can leave

So not going to answer me then about paying out share of the past EU bills? Typical that you want us to pay higher taxes once we've left but are quite happy to dodge paying what we didn't want/sign up for the EU. Can't have your cake and eat it too Kay!
Why should remain voters suffer on bases of leave vote. Leavers should pay more taxes until country is able be on its feet its only fair.

Karen we pay more to countries in aid that don't need it then we do to the eu. Most money to eu comes back to UK in form of grants etc so country isn't out of pocket neither are you. Yet country will be based on leave so you should pay more for your vote
12 billion plus goes to countries based on aid that isn't needed. UK doesn't pay phantom figure of 350million a week as it's discount straight away and we also get grants

Democracy won end of  .. we should all stick together and support the Democratic vote ... theres too many doom and gloomers and ppl trying to bring this great country down like kay bull ... we are the 5th biggest econemy in the world now our goverment knows this and do you really think they would stand by and even contemplate brexit ... no i dont think so ... David Cameron was in full support of brexit until the eu blackmailed him and he had to change his side ...freedom of movement and over immigration has ruined this country and our services carnt cope anymore .. we have 150.000 homeless children that are in care yet were still being bullied to take more refugees ... ppl need to wise up and support the vote ... in the we will win !!! good luck to all for the future !

Face it Kay, the majority voted leave. It was a democratic vote, one which a lot of remainers refuse to abide by. You are also saying that a that voted leave should pay higher taxes because a voted to leave but that you refuse to acknowledge the fact that if the majority wanted to stay that you would be happy for us to keep funding the EU. You are being massively hypocritical in this regard. And whilst you are complaining about the aid that needlessly gets sent abroad on who's order is that? Your precious EU, who blocks every single governing law or right that we tried to implement in our favour. So I repeat, if you're asking me to pay more taxes for the "doom and gloom" you predict that is absolutely fine. I will do, by then you can pay my previous bills that were greedily taken from me. Or you could just accept the vote, stop whinging and trying to justify why "everyone else should pay but me". If I had to accept the state of the country before voting leave then you have to accept the state of the country after. Fair is fair.

Do you actually know anything. EU didn't tell us to send money to other countries we do that because government wants to. Not the eu. We send money to india etc nothing to do with europe. Yes you should pay more. Like I said very little goes to eu. Hey believe rubbish messiah farrage says

Kay Bull then you remainers should pay more tax also. I'm sick to the back teeth of you lot moaning about brexit and blaming those of us who voted leave for ruining the country etc. All your posts have been doom and gloom. Get over it and lighten up like I said. Why should we pay more taxes for our vote just because people like yourself don't like it?? We were entitled to our vote, just as you were entitled to yours.

I explain it simply for you UK isn't in financial position to be successful without us going in to recession again. To avoid this leave voters should pay more tax. Your happy for difficult times to happen so only leave voters should suffer why should rest of us.

Because we should be working together to help progress brexit, therefore those of us who voted out should not be penalised for our vote. You saying we should pay more tax for the suffering we will apparently go through just because in your eyes we caused it and you don't like it will cause divide. If leave voters have to pay more tax, remain voters should pay more tax too. It's only fair. It doesn't matter if you didn't vote out, if your a British taxpayer you shouldn't expect the 17 million people who voted out to foot the bill for your so called suffering. I seriously doubt it will get as bad as the picture you are painting.

Yes you did cause it. You voted leave  knowing difficult times. Remain didn't want another recession or job loses why should we suffer you said you was happy for difficult times ahead. So only leave should have them its fair

Ok if leave voters had to pay more tax, remainers can send us a nice rebate for all the years we've been paying into the EU since its not what we wanted. Like I said we should be working together, brexit has been given the go ahead and we should be working together. It's the remainers causing the divide.

Didn't you read my response for that. Figure based on what is sent to eu and what really is was false caused by farage. We are heavily discounted so fraction of 350m week goes to eu. Far more goes on aid to other countries based on government not eu rules. But I'm happy give you a pound based on your contributions wouldn't be more than that.

Seriously you paint a depressing picture. Que the violins, your basically saying we will all be living in poverty, starving, homeless and jobless after brexit when in fact you don't know it will be like that. We can make trade deals with other nations wether you think it or not. It's only doom and gloom if you make it so.
Then you should be happy pay more tax then remain voters till we are stable. What's wrong with that

Also as I stated earlier what are we known for trade wise very little. Our governments over time have destroyed industry not the eu. You believe propaganda leave has told you. You should be happy pay for better UK. You pay remain don't
We all know that won't happen. We will pay equal amounts and that's how it should be. Just because you voted remain it doesn't mean your exempt from contributing in helping with brexit.
We've contributed more than enough to the precious EU. It won't hurt you lot to help us make brexit work.
Oh now your getting your back up because remain voters think leave should pay. Thought you was happy for difficult times. Are you only happy if everyone suffers.
You contributed very little to the eu. You believe messiah Farage propaganda

Well we are all in this together if we live in the UK. Don't like brexit and love the previous EU so much? Go and live somewhere that is part of it. Or contribute and work together to make it work. Don't blame us because it's not gone your way and say we should pay for it. All British taxpayers should contribute and help out.

We want control of our country back. No more dictatorship from the EU, and that's what the EU is. They say jump, we say how high. They tell us we need to take so many immigrants, we need to build more houses to make room for them etc and we don't have much choice. It's time that ended.
Why should we based on your selfish vote. We aren't going anywhere but we will lobby for high tax etc for leave voters. Why do you get right make our lives harder because you don't like migrants

And why should remainers get an easier life and make the leavers pay for their vote? We should let bygones be bygones, agree to disagree and make brexit a positive thing because otherwise it will be you lot that makes it difficult, not us. Then there will be conflict. It's not down to the leavers to contribute more making it easier for you lot. It doesn't work that way.
So you said your happy suffer short time only if we all suffer. Selfish much
You can talk. You expect the 17 million people who voted brexit to foot the bill. If your a British taxpayer you should contribute which ever way you voted.
And you won't suffer that bad. It's brexit, not the end of the world.

Why should we when your ones who want to leave and possibly put uk back in recession. Remain looked at risks and decided not worth it. So you should suffer not us. We didn't want this and we will rise up if taxes increase
Sure you will.
And I'm the queen mother 😂😂

It's brexiteers vs bremainers now. Again I will say this, it's not down to us to foot your bill because you can't accept brexit and love the EU so much. If we struggle, you will struggle and eventually we will pull through and it will all be worth it.

But you believe what you want, you won't pay higher taxes if they increase, sure. We are all in brexit together wether we like it or not. No amount of arguing, protesting or propoganda will stop that. Goodnight
Your believing ukip propaganda. We will struggle as country and remain voters shouldn't have to pay for it

Like I said believe what you want. But say if taxes do rise after brexit, do you really think those of you who voted remain will be exempt just because you didn't vote out?? You must be kidding yourselves if you do. We are all in it together wether you voted remain or leave. The only ones who won't be affected are the wealthy and the MP's etc.

Fine Kay we'll pay more and then when everything is doing absolutely fine you can pay a higher rate to use out NHS, schools etc because you refused to pay your fair share. Talk about being selfish, you're an absolute spoilt child who is throwing it's dummy out of the pram because you didn't get your way. The EU is finished, face it. And if you think England is so crap and hate the majority (of people who voted leave) so much, why don't you just up and go to your precious Germany... ooops maybe not they've started trying to pay people to leave. Wonder why that is? Probably because Farage was right...just saying.

Great 👌
Now can all the ones that want to remain SHUT THE HELL UP!!  & let us get on with it
Manners cost nothing.
Sorry
Remoaners havnt had a lot of manners towards leave voters

Perhaps because you called them names fir expressing their concerns?  
They're remain voters not 'remoaners'.
Thank you for voting to destroy my children's future

i have children too & I don't see it as destroying their future,  I see it as making it a better one,  
But you're entitled to your opinion 
& clearly the majority of the country feels as I do
Typical buzz words caused by media to belittle people who worried about jobs etc when we leave

Its been disgusting what they have said to people.and im not in the school yard playing tit for tat.what remoaners have called leavers totaly disgusting.and what they have said about pensioners who have worked all there lives and paid into the country has just been deplorable

I'm a 'traitor' for voting remain. 
😂😂😂
I mostly see remain voters challenge the rhetoric of leave voters.  All the empty phrases like 'take back control' and 'make Britain great again' and rarely do they know what they mean.
Remain voters where insulted and still are. all because we worry about our future. We know things will get worse when leave and country won't cope

Totally 100% agree with you,  it was out to a fair vote, some ppl are just bad losers & resort to all kinds of ridiculous things,  I've been called a traitor amongst other things for wanting Britiain to have the great back in her ...  Small minds :/
I'm afraid Britain is not looking great when hateful campaigns win.
I'm not hateful,  if we had lost I would have accepted that, unlike the remainers ...

I dont think anyone is a traitor.everybody has an opion.its just its been a bloody battle.my son was a remainer.so what we havnt fallen out.but if he's put something that is bellow him ive told him but we havnt slagged one anouther of.

I voted remain and I didn't make a huge fuss.
I happen to think you deserve what you voted for.
I'm not making a huge fuss either,  but if it's going to happen can we get on with it,  instead of delays on top of delays,  not asking much
C what i mean if remain had won leave would have had to shut up and put up.it wasnt a hateful campaign we where given an option to either remain or leave nothing else.
Exactly!!
Not quite as simple as that,  seen as we don't know exactly what leave means.

Means we will no longer be answerable to a group of beaurocrats in Brussels, no longer paying ridiculous amounts of money to them, & so on,  I'm happy with my vote to leave & I don't want to have to keep justifying that to anyone

How will we as country cope tho. Yes we need to leave in future but wrong time. We don't have infrastructure to manufacture items that we can trade. We not well known for anything regarding trade. Different if government had invested in future to prepare for exit but they haven't
Peta Evans Go and live in France if you dont like it Petra. Lefty filth like you can live among the gimmigrant filth
Do you want to row the island to the USA?
Is that all you can keep saying mark...plenty of your type about eh

A hateful campaign eh Petra....the left have far more hate in them than any on the right apart from the far right filth...we all hate them...the state our country has got from mid 70's with no investment & short term politics has been a slow shambles, letting 350,000 people in a year is the city the size of Leicester  in a country with no room for anymore cities as we have enough of them...how is that clever at all...the last 20 years has been a farce
